intro: Nasturtium crassifolium, commonly known as broadleaf nasturtium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant is a member of the Tropaeolaceae family and is known for its edible leaves and seeds, which have a peppery taste. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its ornamental value and culinary uses make it a versatile plant in both gardens and kitchens.
